item.title: Follow Your Own Path
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1268" align="alignright" width="198" caption="anjamation on Flickr"][/caption]

“Your vision will become clear only when you look into your heart. Who looks outside, dreams. Who looks inside, awakens.” - Carl G. Jung

I was reading an excerpt out of a book by Carl Jung last night, and was interested to find a concept that parallels one of the ideas in Hero with a Thousand Faces. Namely, that every individual must find and undergo their own path to individual self-actualization, rather than being able to follow some generalized path. This probably explains why we can spend so much time reading how-to's and inspirational blogs and never actually get around to doing something; we are reading about someone else's hero journey, and trying to take it as the direction for our own. Jung's point was that there is no universal psychological concept that can be applied to every person's situation and specific problem, despite the modern trend to try to put everyone under a general diagnosis.
